answers.answer: "i am spoes to go on bedrest for the remainder of my pregnancy which i can't "Preeclampsia is a VERY serious condition - most of the time people who develop this are hospitalized and placed on magnesium in an attempt to control it.  Figure out a way, any way, to follow your doctors orders of going on bedrest unless you want the condition to progress further which will mean definite hospitalization and LIFE-THREATING complications for you and your baby.  Can your husband take leave?  What about using his FLMA?  What about other family members and friends?  I am not sure you realise how very serious preeclampsia is but Im sure that when your support group finds out that you or your baby could DIE as a result of this condition, they will help you get your NEEDED bed rest.

BTW:  you NEED to take bedrest at this point regardless of where you do it.  Surely, it would for preferable for you to do this at home (while you are allowed to) rather than in a nice, expensive hospital for a number of weeks.  If the latter has to occur, someone will have to take care of your kids AND you will have a hefty medical bill to boot.Take care.
